incidents.name: Unable to Login Into Flex Console

incident_updates.body: Twilio Flex was degraded for 15 minutes between 23:27 and 23:40 Pacific Time. During this period of time customers may have experienced login failure or high latency for login into Flex console. The logged-in user may have seen request failures. The issue has now been resolved.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue on Flex Console. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Voice Quality Call Issues to Multiple Countries in Europe

incident_updates.body: We have seen stability in call quality, however the issue has not been fully resolved, and we may experience a recurrence of quality degradation due to heavy packet loss on calls to and from multiple countries in Europe. We have identified the subset of customers affected, are closing this incident post, and will be reaching out to these customers individually for further follow-up.

We have seen stability in the quality of calls, nevertheless the problem has not been totally resolved and we can experience recurrence in quality degradation due to high packet loss in calls to and from multiple countries in Europe. Therefore, we continue to monitor the service to ensure a full recovery and service stability. Well provide another update on 05/16/2023 at 10:25 PDT hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Failure to Verizon Network in the US for a Subset of Long Codes via 10DLC

incident_updates.body: SMS delivery failures to Verizon Network in the US for a subset of long-codes via 10DLC between around 13:00 PM PST on 05/11/2023 and about 11:30  PST on 05/12/2023. During this period of time, customers sending those messages received a negative DLR back corresponding to lack of permission to send on that route. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on ~15% of Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: We will close the post on Twilios Status Page. If you have been impacted by this incident and wish to continue to receive updates, please open a ticket with customer support.

We have observed that the recent impact was limited to devices connected over AT&T. Currently, we are monitoring the situation as approximately 3% of devices may still experience connectivity issues. These devices might encounter a poor data connection or have short-lived sessions.

Our engineering team is actively working alongside the affected network provider to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. In the meantime, we kindly suggest that customers reset the connectivity through the console if they notice that some of their SIM cards are still experiencing issues. This can often help re-establish a stable connection for the affected devices. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have observed that the recent impact was limited to devices connected over AT&T. Currently, we are monitoring the situation as approximately 3% of devices may still experience connectivity issues. These devices might encounter a poor data connection or have short-lived sessions.

Our engineering team is actively working alongside the affected network provider to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. In the meantime, we kindly suggest that customers reset the connectivity through the console if they notice that some of their SIM cards are still experiencing issues. This can often help re-establish a stable connection for the affected devices.

We have observed that the recent impact was limited to devices connected over AT&T. Currently, we are still monitoring the situation as approximately 5% of devices may still experience connectivity issues. These devices might encounter poor data connection or have short-lived sessions. Our engineering team is actively working alongside the affected network provider to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. We will provide another update in 4 hours or sooner as soon as we have more information available.

We have observed that the recent impact was limited to devices connected over AT&T. Currently, we are still monitoring the situation as approximately 5% of devices may still experience connectivity issues. These devices might encounter poor data connection or have short-lived sessions. Our engineering team is actively working alongside the affected network provider to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner as soon as we have more information available.

Beginning at 8:45 UTC, we observed ~15% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

Beginning at 8:45 UTC, we observed ~15% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner once more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Super SIM Connectivity Interruption

incident_updates.body: The Super SIM connectivity interruptions have been resolved and Super SIM is operating normally at this time.

Our engineering team has put in a fix to address the issue causing connectivity interruption. We are seeing recovery and are continuing to monitor for service performance. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

At 3:50 PM PST, the service that previously restarted leading to a drop in connectivity did so again. The previous incident link is https://manage.statuspage.io/pages/gpkpyklzq55q/incidents/phgdhvmjs4x0. A new instance has been deployed and the impacted one has been taken out of the load balancer. Devices currently connected through the new instance and will continue to stay connected as sessions are slowly drained from it.

incidents.name: On Call Engineers are Investigating an issue

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the authentication issue triggered by our automated alert, and it was determined that there is no noticeable customer impact. All systems are operational.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with authentication for Programmable Voice. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Super SIM Connectivity Interruption

incident_updates.body: Our engineering team has identified the the root cause of the service restart to be a side effect of an internal tool used for capturing packet traces to help support customers. We have suspended use of this tool until a fix for this issue is deployed. There should not be anymore connectivity interruptions for Super SIM.

At 11:13 AM PST, approximately 4% of data sessions connected through the super or us1.super APNs were dropped causing devices to disconnect. This was due to one of the services responsible for routing data traffic between devices and the internet restarting unexpectedly. Devices that lost connectivity should have been able to immediately reconnect to one of the other instances of the same service. The impacted service was recovered within 30 seconds and resumed handling traffic. This issue was not a result of any issues at our downstream connectivity partners.
Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update in 1 hour or as soon as we have additional information.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with super sim connectivity issues in the US. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have additional information.

incidents.name: 500s for billing-related APIs

incident_updates.body: Billing APIs and Console pages was degraded for 30 minutes between 9:20 and 9:50 Pacific Time on 05/10/2023. During this period, customers may have experienced timeouts and were unable to setup new Flex Accounts, unable to upgrade their Flex Accounts from Flex Trial to Paid and billing information in the console failed to load. The issue has now been resolved.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with some APIs querying billing data are currently degraded. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: MMS delivery failures to a subset of US carriers

incident_updates.body: MMS delivery was degraded for around 6 hours between 23:30 PT and 6:15 Pacific Time on 5/9/2023 to 5/10/2023. During this period, customers may have experienced failures to send MMS to a subset of US carriers. The issue has now been resolved.
